intro: Hyperbaena winzerlingii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique floral display.
